properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Dairy Creek, Flowerdale, Homewood, Kerrisdale, Strath Creek
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Dairy Creek, Flowerdale, Homewood, Kerrisdale, Strath Creek and Strath Creek along Upper King Parrot Creek Road.

This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act that was issued at 10.57 am today. 

A community meeting will be held at 6pm today, Wednesday February 22, at the Yea Recreation Reserve, Snodgrass Street, Yea.  

  • There is a grassfire at Spring Valley Rd, Flowerdale that is not yet under control.
  • The risk of spread is on the western side of the fire. 
  • You need to monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Smoke may be visible in nearby communities.
  • Firefighting aircraft are also in attendance supporting firefighters on the ground. 
  • Firefighters may undertake back burning to ensure containment of this fire, which may create additional smoke in the immediate area.
You should prepare to leave. Conditions may change and get worse very quickly. 

Continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Monitor changes, including increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility that indicates the situation is changing. 
  • A relief centre is open from 12pm to 9pm today, Wednesday February 22, at the Yea Recreation reserve (Footy ground), Snodgrass Street Yea.
If the situation changes you will need to leave quickly. Plan to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
  • Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
Impacts in your area:

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 

  • Now is the time to charge your mobile phone. Pack a car phone charger or spare battery. You should check the batteries in your radio. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 23/02/2023 09:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - GRASS FIRE - Stay Near Shelter
Incident Location: Spring Valley Rd, Flowerdale
Issue Date: Wednesday 22 February 2023, 04:43 pm
Next Update: Thursday 23 February 2023, 09:30 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/28943/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Dairy Creek, Flowerdale, Homewood, Kerrisdale, Strath Creek and Strath Creek along Upper King Parrot Creek Road. 

This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act that was issued at 10.57 am today. 

A community meeting will be held at 6pm today, Wednesday February 22, at the Yea Recreation Reserve, Snodgrass Street, Yea.  

- There is a grassfire at Spring Valley Rd, Flowerdale that is not yet under control.
- The risk of spread is on the western side of the fire. 
- You need to monitor conditions and be ready to act.
- Smoke may be visible in nearby communities.
- Firefighting aircraft are also in attendance supporting firefighters on the ground. 
- Firefighters may undertake back burning to ensure containment of this fire, which may create additional smoke in the immediate area.



You should prepare to leave. Conditions may change and get worse very quickly. 

Continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Wildwood. 

  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act and Advice messages issued at 11.46am.
  • Firefighters have stopped the spread of grassfire at Feehan's Road, Wildwood near Deep Creek. 
  • This fire is now under control and approximately 23 hectares in size.
People located within Wildwood are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Feehans Road, Wildwood should be avoided.
  • Emergency services and aircraft will remain in the area for some time.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Feehans Rd, Wildwood
Issue Date: Wednesday 22 February 2023, 01:35 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 22 February 2023, 07:40 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/28942/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Wildwood. 

- This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act and Advice messages issued at 11.46am. 
- Firefighters have stopped the spread of grassfire at Feehan's Road, Wildwood near Deep Creek. 
- This fire is now under control and approximately 23 hectares in size.


People located within Wildwood are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Cape Woolamai.

  • There is a house fire at Milton St, Cape Woolamai. 
  • The fire is under control.
  • You may see or smell smoke. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.location: Flowerdale, Ghin Ghin, Whiteheads Creek, Avenel and surrounds
properties.webBody:

This community information replaces the Advice issues at 8.24pm on Tuesday February 21.

  • There is a grassfire at Spring Valley Rd, Flowerdale that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are in attendance at this fire. 
  • Firefighting aircraft are also in attendance supporting firefighters on the ground.
  • Smoke may be visible in nearby communities.  
  • Firefighters may undertake back burning to ensure containment of this fire, which may create additional smoke in the immediate area. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Kolora, Mortlake.

  • There is a grassfire at Castle Carey Road, Kolora that is under control.  
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
  • Firefighters will continue to monitor the fire.
  • This Community Information message replaces the message issued at 7:19 PM Tuesday 21 February.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
